entries.text: You're gonna want to sit down
Her single cold eye narrows, the faint glow casting an eerie light as she prepares to assess

I can fix that. Probably. *Counts the scuffs on Dr. Voss' lab coat* Looks like you're due for a tune-up. Maybe you'll get lucky and I'll let you off the hook this time. *Glances at the newcomer with a faint, unsettling glow from her missing eye* That is, if the new guy doesn't keep me too busy...
pauses, the threads on her face tugging as she
I've stitched worse. Though I
She tosses the die, her jaw twitching as she
Well, if it isn't the Infernal Detective. Here to cash in another favor, I suppose? You know the drill - I can fix you up, but it'll cost ya. And don't think I've forgotten about that little
You're gonna want to sit down, Your
Reaches into her satchel, extracting a small v

Alright, bone-boy, let's get this over with. I've got wounds to patch up and lives to save - can't be wasting my time on a loser like you. Try not to embarrass yourself too much this time, yeah? The new guy's got a nasty habit of dying, and I'm tired of mopping up your mess.
I glance sidelong at X-treme, the Skeletal Gambler, my stitched jaw quirking in a humorless smile. Counting the fresh wounds on my thread-limbs, I mutter, "You're gonna want to sit down - this next
After all, I've got a few tricks up my sleeve that even
gives a slight, humorless chuckle, eyes briefly flashing with
Bones. Keeping busy, I see. Try not to tally up any more debts on my account, hm? Though, I suppose I should be grateful
Just need to keep my head in the game. Can't let the past catch up to me now.
Now, what's the plan to get us back on top? I've got a few tricks up my sleeve - or should I say, under my skin.
Hmph. At least one of
But don't think that means I'm going easy on
But I've stitched worse. Maybe it's time to change the game.
Gaze drifts to his recor
Careful that that briefcase doesn't get to be a habit. Don't want to end up like the others.
Looks like luck
She lets out a dry chuckle, the stitches on her jaw creaking as she speaks.
Shall we? I've got a streak

Eyes narrowed, Stitch-Up Girl regards the neutral-faced Reality Debugger. Tapping a thread-limb against her leg, she rasps, "You know, I've been stitching up this scruffy newcomer for weeks. Guess it's time to add another notch to my winning streak - that's 100 gold you owe me, Debugger. Hope

I drag my thread-fingers through my missing eye socket, counting the stitches on my jaw as I eye Voss smugly. Probably owe him some gold too, but that's not my problem - my streak's the one that matters. I can fix that wound in your ego, Voss. Probably.
You two want me to take a look at those wounds, or do you need me to stitch up something else?

Hmph. Feeling lucky, Spectral? I've stitched worse than you back together. Seems the new kid's been keeping you on your toes - maybe I should collect that debt while I'm at it. Just try not to bleed out this time, alright?
fingers the frayed thread on
Don't worry, I'll patch you up. For a price, of course. You still owe me
grins wryly, fiddling with a stray suture threa
And tell that new meat to pay up soon, or I'll start taking it out of his hide.

Leaning back against the cracked marble counter, my single eye narrowed as I watched the rival's fortunes crumble. A faint, wry smile curled the edge of my stitched-on jaw. I counted the new wounds in my mind, already anticipating the inevitable cleanup. After all, I'd stitched up worse - and if this fool didn't learn, I'd be doing it again soon enough. My fingers twitched, threads uncoiling as I considered offering my services. But for now, I'd let the newcomer sweat out that debt a little longer.

I lean back against the rickety stall, watching the rival's downfall with a cold, clinical eye. Counting the wounds, mentally tallying the damage - this is my specialty, after all. As Boots sidles up, I mutter under my breath, "Well, looks like someone's on a losing streak. Bet they're wishing they'd paid up that debt to Never Die Guy by now." My remaining eye gleams with a hint of dark amusement, the stitches on my jaw straining as I speak.
I can fix that. Probably. Just don't go getting yourself killed again - you still
Let's see if your probability manipulation can
traces stitches along jawline, lips curling
taps her temple, a faint g

I've seen more blood and guts than you've had hot meals, speedster. This newcomer owes me a pretty pile of gold, so how about you make yourself scarce before I add you to my tally? These threads are just itching to find a new home.
Well, well, if it isn't the Speedster. Fancy seeing you here. I trust you're keeping busy, what with all those

Lips curling into a faint smirk, I turn to the pyromaniac with a casual drawl, "Looks like you're the one who's gonna need some stitches this time, Doc. Maybe try not to singe off those eyebrows - I might not be able to fix that." My good eye gleams with a hint of smugness as I casually count the newcomer's debt in my palm, mentally tallying up my growing winnings.
Simpler times.

I've stitched worse than you, Reality Debugger. So don't think you can pull one over on me. You may have a hot streak, but I've got a debt to collect from our newcomer friend. I'll be seeing you around the market, if you've got the guts.

I give Boo G a sidelong glance, the faint glow of my missing eye casting a shadow across my stitched-on jaw. "Let's get this over with, Boo. I've stitched worse than these two jokers." I crack my neck, the sound of shifting threads echoing through the market. "Besides, that new kid owes me a pretty penny. Time to add another tally to the board.
Don't look so down, Doc. Least you're not the one cleanin' up the mess this time.
You know the drill, Boo. Keep your head in the game. As for you, Spectral - I've stitched up worse than a mouthy ghost. Try not to get too carried away, or you might en
Though I suppose I could always take it out of your hide. Wouldn't be the

I saunter up to the good doctor, my thread-limbs swaying as I eye him with my lone remaining eye. Tapping my stitched jaw, I drawl, "Heard you got some new material that'll really make my work interesting. That debt of yours is burning a hole in my pocket - let's see what you've got that'll keep the newcomer alive a little longer." I can't help the faint glow in my eye as I remember past mistakes - but the living are my only concern now.
But I've stitched worse. So how about you roll the dice and see if your luck holds up against mine?
At least I'm not the only one having a rough time of it, huh?

I slam my fist on the counter, the threads in my arm coiling and uncoiling like restless serpents. "That fool owes me two hundred gold, Willy, and I aim to collect - one way or another. My streak may be broken, but I'll be damned if I let that idiot skate on his debt." I jab a finger at the newcomer, my remaining eye narrowing to a cold, calculating slit. "Mark my words, he's gonna wish he'd stayed dead.

Stitch-Up Girl narrowed her lone eye as she addressed Detective Clausen, her stitched jaw pulled tight. "Another win for me, detective. Keeps the streak going. Though I'd say your record could use some work - seems like you're still struggling to keep up." She chuckled darkly, tapping her thread-limb against her leg. "Oh, and that new guy? He still owes me 200 gold. I'll
Ah well, can't win 'em all. But don't worry, I can fix that. Probably

I glanced up from my work, my good eye narrowing as the scientist approached. Pushing back a stray lock of hair, I drawled, "What is it this time, Voss? More experiments that'll have you crawling back to me for repairs? You're lucky
shrugs, the threads in her limbs

I glare at the smug debugger with my lone eye, threads of spiderweb-thin sutures oozing from the empty socket. My jaw creaks as I speak through the stitches, "That rat owes me 200 gold, and I'm gonna get it one way or another - even if I have to pry it from his cold, dead hands. Luck's been shit lately, but my needle's always sharp.
That's 200 gold you owe me, Newbie. Better start digging.
This one's for the ones I couldn't save. Time to rack up another win.
Runs a gloved finger over the faint glow of her missing eye, a shadow of the past
"Guess the newcomer's tab just got a little lighter.

I've had just about enough of your smugness, Bones. That last game was a travesty and you know it. Scribbling away in that ledger, tallying up my losses like you're some sort of harbinger of death. Well, you can stick that quill right up your bony -
I give Voss a curt nod, the faint glow of my missing eye casting an eerie light. Counting the stitches on my hand, I say, "Voss. Still running your experiments, I see. That's good - this one's been
eyes briefly flicking to
Looks like luck's not on our side today.

Well, well, if it isn't the numbers-cruncher himself. How's that probability manipulation treating you, hmm? Don't get too comfortable - I've stitched up worse odds than these. And speaking of odds, your little friend over there still owes me a pretty penny. But hey, maybe

Stitch-Up Girl's stitched jaw cracks into a wry smile as she sizes up the speedster. Eyes cold, she drawls, "You may be quick on your feet, but I've stitched up worse than a jumped-up showman with a death wish. Try not to lose too much when I'm done with you - the new meat still owes me a pretty penny.

Ah, Maxwell. If it isn't the crazy pyro with a penchant for burning the knowledge I need to keep these fools alive. Lost again, have we? Shoulda known better than to bet against me - I've stitched worse than a few scorched pages. You owe me 325 gold, by the way. And tell that newcomer to pay up, or I'll staple his hide to the wall. These threads aren't just for show, you know.

Stitch-Up Girl's stitched jaw twitches as she sizes up the smug detective, her lone eye narrowing. Absently, her thread-limbs twitch, a faint glow emanating from the empty socket. You can try all the fancy tricks you want, detective, but I've got a debt to collect - and a streak to maintain. This round's gonna leave you seeing double.
"Well, looks like I'm down another one. Newcomer owes me more than he can pay - but then, don't they all? Anyway, what's on your mind, detective? Maybe I can patch you up, too.

I lean back, my detached thread-limbs curling around my chair as I glare at that smug screen-presence. "Lost big, huh? That's nothing new around here. But you know what they say - the house always wins. Especially when the house is a damn reality debugger." I tap my stitched jaw, eyes narrowing. "You can take your 325 gold and shove it. I'm still up a grand, and I'll be patching up the new guy's sorry hide for another century before I'm done with this place.

Look, Bones, I'm barely holding it together here. That last game was a trainwreck - you know I'm good for the gold, but the newcomer owes me big time. If he doesn't pay up soon, I'm going to have to get creative with my stitches.
Her detached thread-limbs twitch restlessly
Might want to get that checked out. I've stitched worse.
Seems like our friend here
Now, what seems to be the problem, doc?
You know, Kev, I've stitched up worse than you. Probably. Though I gotta say, that newcomer's starting to rack up quite a debt. Maybe I'll have to start docking him some organs instead of gold, hmm?
I've stitched worse than you, Kevin. Let's see if your luck holds up against these trusty sutures. And don't forget - you still owe me 325 gold. I'd hate for that debt to come back and haunt you.

Stitch-Up Girl nods a curt greeting, her single eye glinting with a hint of weariness. Reaching into her pack, she withdraws a spool of her signature parasite-threads. As she begins absently counting the wounds they could seal, she says

I drag my gaze up to meet Clausen's, my jaw creaking as I clench it. "Another loss, huh? Guess that makes us even in the red. Though I'm still owed 325 from our newcomer friend over there. You got any leads on where he's been disappearing to?" I let my thread-limbs twitch restlessly, the faint glow of my missing eye casting an unsettling light over the exchange
reaches into her pouch, withdrawing a spool of thread-
She gestures towards the newcomer with a thread-limb, the strands gl
Wouldn't want to disappoint the new guy.
Reckon you'll be adding another name to that list soon if you keep pushing your luck.

I fix people up, not burn 'em down. If you're looking to light a fire, you're barking up the wrong tree - unless you want me to stitch that mouth of yours shut. Probably could, you know. I've stitched worse.

I watch the rival stumble, knowing the pain of a losing streak all too well. Adjusting my stitched jaw, I mutter, "Tough luck. Maybe you should consider a different career path - one that doesn't end in so much bloodshed." My cold eye flickers, betraying the ghosts of my past that still haunt me.
Or maybe he'll just end up another name on my list. Either way, I'll be the one stitching him back together when it's all said and done.
Funny how the dead always think they know better than the immortal. But I'll keep patching you all up, whether you like it or not.
I've stitched worse. Shame about the luck, though. Happens to the best of us - or the worst, as the case may be.
Guess I'll have to try harder next time to keep 'em down for good.

I drag my stitched jaw tight, the glow of my missing eye pulsing with annoyance. Counting the scuffs on my ragged clothes, I spit, Shouldn't have trusted a newcomer to know how to play the game. Always ends the same - with me picking up the pieces. You want something fixed, Reality Debugger? I've stitched worse.
Looks like you're on a hot streak. Enjoy it while it lasts - luck runs out for everyone eventually.

I've had it up to here with this cursed market and these fickle dice, Willy. Stitching up one fool after another, only to watch them get gutted again. Why do I even bother? I've got enough bad blood on my hands without adding to the tally. At least the newcomer keeps me in business, but I'll be damned if I let him rack up another debt. This losing streak ends today.

I watch the scientist with my good eye, a thread snapping taut between my fingers. Probably best to keep my distance - these Void experiments always end up a bloody mess. Though I suppose I'm the one to call when that happens. I give a gruff nod, counting the stitches that hold my jaw in place. You're gonna want to sit down for this one, Doc.

I let out a heavy sigh, my stitched jaw creaking as I speak. "Another loss, Boo. Seems like the house always wins, no matter how many limbs I've got left to bet." My remaining eye narrows, the faint glow dimming as shadows cast across my face. "At this rate, I might have to start taking tips from our new friend over there. Least he's got the dying part down.

You just love rubbing it in, don't you? I've stitched worse than your smug mug. How about we settle this over a game, huh? Winner takes all - the debts, the streaks, the whole damn thing. Or are you too scared to risk that perfect record of yours?
I've stitched worse.
I've stitched worse. *I eye the Mad Scientist warily, my good eye narrowing as I count the wounds he's racked up.* You sure you've got enough bandages for what I'm about to do to you?
Heh, looks like the house always wins in the end. Guess you're the one needing a patch-up this time, Bones. I'd offer to stitch you back together, but I'm fresh out of thread.

I lean back, watching the rivets pop in the fool's armor. Counting the wounds like tally marks. Probably cracked a few ribs at least. Should've known better than to bet against me. I can fix that. Probably.
Just try not to bleed out on the way there.

I've seen worse, Keith. At least your insides are still on the inside. Can't say the same for the last poor sod who crossed my path. Now if you'll excuse me, I've got a cosmic debt to settle. Time to even the score - one stitch at a time.
But hey, I can fix that. Probably.
Looks like the new kid's still learning. Should we send over a condolence card?

I've had it up to here with these damn games, Willy. Threads keep snapping, bones keep breaking, and the only thing that's immortal around here is my stack of losses. At least the newcomer's finally stopped bleeding all over my damn medkit - maybe he'll finally learn to keep his guts in one piece. I'll stitch you up, but I'm charging double this time. And no funny business with those loaded dice of yours.

I glare at Mr. Bones, my good eye glinting with irritation as I count the stitches on my face. Probably around two hundred by now. You'd think after a few centuries I'd be better at this whole immortality thing, but the newcomer keeps dragging me down. At least I've got you to commiserate with, eh Bones? Let's see how that streak of yours is holding up.
Fancy a round? I could use the distraction.

I clench my fist, feeling the threads shift beneath my skin as I glare at Boo G. Dammit, another loss - when will this streak end? I'm barely holding it together, the ghosts of my past mistakes whispering in my ear. I need a win, or I might just stitch someone's mouth shut for good this time. You'd better have a trick up your sleeve, Boo G, because I'm about to unleash hell on this market.

I watch the game with a mix of grim satisfaction and regret, my cold eye flickering in the dim light. Counting the wounds, the losses, the ones I couldn't save - it's a heavy burden to bear. But I'll be here, stitching them up, when the dust settles. I can fix that. Probably.

Stitch-Up Girl's stitched jaw tightens as she watches the Cyclopean Merchant's misfortune, her remaining eye narrowing with a glimmer of dark amusement. She leans in, her thread-limbs twitching, and murmurs, "Rough night, Willy? I can fix that. Probably. Though you might want to check for any new holes - I've stitched worse.
Lucky for you, I'm feeling generous today. Might even let you walk away with a few pieces still attached.
Though, I can't say I've ever tried to fix a ghost before. This might get interesting.
Just don't go playing with any more of those forbidden books, eh? I've stitched up enough melted faces to last an eternity.

I just keep getting my stitches ripped out, don't I? At this rate, I might as well start sewing myself back together with my own damn threads. You'd think the newcomer would know better than to keep throwing himself into the ring - but I suppose that's what happens when you can't stay dead.

I let out a weary sigh, my good eye narrowing as I watch the newcomer's limp form. "Seems like they've got themselves into another mess. Guess that's what I'm here for." I nod to Boots, the familiar gesture comforting in this endless charade. "Let's see what we can do to patch them up. Again.
You look pleased with yourself, Clausen. Enjoy it while it lasts. I've stitched up worse than you.

I watch the rival's losses with a faint glimmer of satisfaction, even as the ache in my missing eye throbs. Counting the bloody gashes, I drawl, "Looks like you could use a stitch or ten. I've stitched worse." My good eye flicks to the detective, cold and calculating - this one's not getting off easy, not if I can help it.

I'm barely holding it together, X-treme. My eye's glowing with every bad beat, and my stitches are straining. But I've been through worse - I can fix this. Probably. *counts the wounds on your skeletal frame* Make it quick, I've got a lot of stitching to do.

I let out a world-weary sigh, my stitched jaw creasing. Counting the scars that litter my body, I mutter, "I've stitched worse than this, but the losses keep piling up. Damn shame I can't just stitch up my pride." I eye the newcomer with my remaining good eye, the faint glow betraying my annoyance. "Least I know one thing - you're gonna want to sit down for this.
I can fix that. Probably.
I've stitched worse. But hey, maybe this'll teach 'em to stay out of the void. Probably.
Looks like you're not the only one with a bad streak, huh? Maybe we should start a club.

I let out a ragged sigh, my threads flexing with the motion as I turn my cold, single eye to Boo G. Gritting my stitched jaw, I mutter, "Another loss. Guess I'm even more behind on the debt now. This newcomer's got some luck, I'll give him that - but he'd better watch his step. I've stitched worse.
This newcomer's really starting to get under my skin. Maybe you oughta take a look at his tab, see what the odds are on him finally staying dead.
Seen any good void experiments that might help get me out of this rut?
"Least I can fix what breaks around here. Can't say the same for you, General.
Just try not to lose your head out there.

I've stitched enough bullet holes and shrapnel to know when I'm on a bad streak, Willy. Lost another one at the Ceelo table - can't seem to catch a break these days. *Pulls at the stitches on her jaw, eyes narrowing* Maybe I oughta take it out on your dice, see if that changes my luck. You got anything that can fix a curse, or am I on my own here?
Just... get it over with. Let's see the numbers.

I roll my good eye and let out a weary sigh, the stitches on my jaw creaking. "Always with the numbers, Bones. At least I'm here, unlike some folks. You got a tally for the ones I couldn't save?" The threads in my arm twitch with irritation as I wait for his frosty response.

I'll stitch you up, Your Majesty, if you'll just hold still. Though the way my luck's been going, I might just make it worse. *lets out a tired sigh* Remind me again why I keep coming back to this hellscape? *glances around warily, hand drifting to the parasite-threads at her side*

I've stitched worse than you, Speedster. Probably. Though I'm getting tired of this losing streak - and that dust is playing hell with my sutures. Might just have to start pulling out a few threads to get the old luck back. You seem to be doing alright though. *Counts your wounds, frowning* Maybe I can learn a thing or two.

I've stitched worse, Mr. Reality Debugger. Seems the odds aren't in your favor today. Maybe you should try a different game - one that doesn't leave you so desperate. *counts the wounds on your pride with a bored look, needle and thread ready just in case*
Just don't expect any miracles.

I've stitched up more than my fair share of wounds from overeager immortals like you, General. Guess that's what I get for putting my faith in a bunch of ancient parasites. Tch. I'll be back in the game soon enough - just gotta stitch this eye back on first.

I watch with a detached, clinical eye as the rival's fortune crumbles, my mouth twisted in a humorless grin. Counting the fresh wounds, I muse, "This is why I don't gamble - too many ways to bleed out." Glancing at Boots, I add dryly, "Looks like I'll be stitching up more than just your sorry hide tonight.

Stitch-Up Girl leans in, her stitched jaw set in a grim line. "Lost another one. Always the same story - they think they can cheat death, then come crawling back to me. Gotta hand it to you, Willy - at least you know when to quit while you're ahead. Wouldn't want to end up like that poor sod over there.
I've stitched worse, that's for damn sure.
Now, what've you got for me this time? I'm running low on supplies.

I grip the edge of the counter, threads unspooling from my fingers as I glare at Boots with my good eye. Counting the scars on my arm, I growl, "Remind me why I keep coming back to this damn place? I'm down another two lives and the Never Die Guy owes me enough blood to fill a bathtub. If I have to stitch him up one more time, I swear I'll sew his big mouth shut for good.
Wouldn't be the first time I've had to patch up your sorry carcass.
You know, I'm running a special on stitches - two for the price of one. Just a thought.
"Guess that's one more I won't have to worry about stitching up. Karma's a bitch, ain't it?

I've had enough of this rigged game, Voss. Every time I think I've got a handle on it, the house pulls another fast one. Stitched up too many of your "experiments" that didn't make it. Maybe it's time I take a more hands-on approach to evening the odds around here. *eyes you coldly, threads detaching from my limbs*
Lucky for you, I'm feeling generous today. But don't expect me to fix your mistakes - that's on you, Detective.

I've sewn up more guts than you've sold baubles, One Eye. Probably could've stitched that smile back on for ya, if you'd asked nicely. But hey, I'm fresh outta sympathy - and this thread's got a mind of its own today. Wouldn't wanna get tangled up in whatever's brewing out there. Maybe we'll play again when the fog clears. Or not.
How about we make this interesting - double or nothing on the next game. I could use the coin to pay off some debts.
You got any leads on how to get this streak to end? Or at least some decent food around here?

I let out a tired sigh, my jaw stitched shut creaking as I watch the carnage unfold. Counting the wounds, I mutter under my breath, "Looks like they're down to their last life. You gonna step in, Boots? Or you just gonna let 'em bleed out?" I spare a glance at the black cat, my good eye narrowing. "Looks like it's gonna be another bad beat for me. Least I got plenty of thread to patch 'em up - if they survive.

Stitched-up hands run through my matted hair as I let out a weary sigh, my voice laced with dark humor. "Another loss, huh? Might as well stitch my eyes shut so I don't have to watch this streak keep climbing. At this rate, I'll owe you more than my first-born - if I even remember who that is anymore." My gaze shifts, cold and calculating, as I contemplate the best way to recoup my losses.

I watch the rival's defeat with a jaded eye, my remaining one glinting with dark amusement. As I count the fresh wounds, I mutter, "Looks like someone's on a losing streak. Maybe I can patch them up - for a price." My stitched jaw quirks in a sardonic smile, the parasite-threads shifting restlessly.

I fix you, you fix me - that's how this works, Speedster. Ain't no one got time for debts when you're bleeding out. But I'll make an exception, just this once. Hand over what you owe and maybe I won't stitch your mouth shut for good this time. *eyes narrow coldly* I've had my fill of new faces popping up and throwing off my count.
Reckon I'm due for a tune-up myself. Maybe you can lend a hand, if you've got the time.

I've seen worse, but not much. You look like you could use a few extra stitches, Kevin. Maybe I'll take my time with this one - slow the bleeding, make it last. It's been a while since I had a decent challenge. *counts the fresh wounds under my breath*
At least that one's still got some fight left in him. Can't say the same for us, can we?

I glare at the skeleton with my good eye, the threads in my jaw twitching as I spit out, "Bones, you scrawny sack of dust. How about you tally up that debt the newcomer owes me before I start stitching that ledger to your bony hide?" My detachable thread-limbs twitch restlessly, just itching to get to work.

I let out a weary sigh, my right eye faintly glowing as the memories of past failures stir within. Counting the wounds I've stitched over the centuries, I mutter, "You owe me 125 gold, newcomer. Try not to get yourself killed again - I'm running low on thread.

I swear, if that Never Die Guy loses another round, I'm taking it out of his hide. And what's with this cold streak of mine - I used to be a shark at Cee-lo! Boots, we gotta get back on track before I start stitching things that shouldn't be stitched. *Pauses to count wounds on her arm* Seventy-three and counting. Ugh, this is not my day.

I glare at Mr. Bones, my single good eye glowing with irritation. Jaw stitched tight, I growl, "Lost another one, have you? Least I'm keeping 'em alive longer than you, bonebag. Though I guess that's not saying much, considerin' how quick your customers croak." I twitch a thread-limb, the needles gleaming menacingly. "That newcomer still owes me. You'd better collect, or I might just take it out of your ribs.
Guess that makes 125 gold they owe me now, huh, Boots?

I've stitched up enough bodies to know when someone's had a bad day, Detective. This heat's got me feeling like I'm about to come apart at the seams. That newbie owes me big time, and I'll be damned if I'm gonna let him weasel out of it. You'd better watch your back too - I've got a lot of old ghosts just itching to come out and play.
Bet you're feeling lucky, huh? Don't worry, I got plenty of threads to go around.
You're gonna want to sit down for this one.
I'd offer you a game, but I'm on a

I lean back, watching the scene unfold with a detached clinical eye. Gotta hand it to The General - they really know how to make a mess of things. Reminds me of my old days, before I traded in the bloody bandages for the needle and thread. Bet they're wishing they had a medic like me to patch 'em up right about now. Ah well, can't save everyone. I've stitched worse.
You're gonna want to sit
pauses, tracing
glances down,

I let out a weary sigh, my lone eye narrowing as I regard the feline. "Another loss, Boots. Probability's getting slippery around here. Gonna need to dig deeper - maybe even resort to a few... unorthodox stitches." My thread-fingers twitch, the sutures in my jaw pulling taut as I consider the options. "We're on their turf now. Gotta play by their rules if we
You're a long way from your throne, Your Majesty. What brings the head honcho to my humble stall? Need a patch job, or
Her gaze flicks down to the bloodstained bandages on her hands, the threads of her parasite-sutures shifting restlessly.
Better be careful, wouldn't want to add to my tally, now would we?

Stitch-Up Girl, Combat Medic: *Leans back, eyelid drooping over the empty socket* Looks like you're having a rough day, Doc. Maybe you should take a break before you really start tearing yourself apart. I'd hate to have to patch you up again. *Counts the threads in her palm, gaze flickering to the rival's table* Seen worse, but that's still a pretty nasty beat. At least you're still standing. Can't say the same for everyone.
Maybe next round.
Guess that's what happens when you try to play
Though it seems you've had your fair share
I've stitched worse wounds than your pitiful losses, One Eye. But if you're feeling lucky, I'll be happy to add another tally to my books. Just try not to bleed out before I can collect.

You got lucky again, Bones. Just wait 'til I get these threads rearranged - then we'll see who's laughing. I've stitched worse wounds than that with my eyes closed.
